com.ensoftcorp.open.pcg.factory

Class IPCGFactory

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getICFGFromInteractions(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q entryMethods, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods1, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods2, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
      Constructs the Inter-procedural CFG using CFGs of two given sets of methods M1, M2, and the methods containing the following events: Callsites to methods in the union of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M1 and M2 respectively The computation is restricted to the forward call graph from entryMethods.
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getIPCGFromEvents(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q explicitMethods, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events) 
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getIPCGFromInteractions(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q entryMethods, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods1, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods2, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
      Constructs the Inter-procedural PCG using two given sets of methods M1, M2, and the following events: Callsites to methods in the union of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M1 and M2 respectively The computation is restricted to the forward call graph from entryMethods.
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getIPCGIncludingPairwiseCCAs(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q entryMethods, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods1, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods2, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
      Constructs the Inter-procedural PCG using two given sets of methods M1, M2, and the following events: Callsites to methods in the union of the pairwise intersection of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M1 and M2 respectively The computation is restricted to the forward call graph from entryMethods.
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getIPCGIncludingPairwiseLCCAs(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods, com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
      Constructs the Inter-procedural PCG by including following events: Callsites of the following methods - union of the LEAVES of pairwise intersections of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M LCCA stands for Lowest Common Call Ancestor, i.e., the LEAVES of the intersection of reverse call chains of each pair (m1, m2) of methods.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getIPCGIncludingPairwiseLCCAs(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods,
                                                                              com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
        Constructs the Inter-procedural PCG by including following events: Callsites of the following methods - union of the LEAVES of pairwise intersections of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M LCCA stands for Lowest Common Call Ancestor, i.e., the LEAVES of the intersection of reverse call chains of each pair (m1, m2) of methods.
        Parameters:
        methods - set of methods M
        events -
        Returns:

      • getIPCGIncludingPairwiseCCAs

        public static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getIPCGIncludingPairwiseCCAs(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q entryMethods,
                                                                             com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods1,
                                                                             com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods2,
                                                                             com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
        Constructs the Inter-procedural PCG using two given sets of methods M1, M2, and the following events: Callsites to methods in the union of the pairwise intersection of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M1 and M2 respectively The computation is restricted to the forward call graph from entryMethods. CCA stands for Common Call Ancestor, i.e., the intersection of reverse call chains of each pair (m1, m2) of methods.
        Parameters:
        entryMethods -
        methods1 - first set of methods M1
        methods2 - second set of methos M2
        events -
        Returns:

      • getIPCGFromInteractions

        public static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getIPCGFromInteractions(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q entryMethods,
                                                                        com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods1,
                                                                        com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods2,
                                                                        com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
        Constructs the Inter-procedural PCG using two given sets of methods M1, M2, and the following events: Callsites to methods in the union of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M1 and M2 respectively The computation is restricted to the forward call graph from entryMethods. "Interactions" as opposed to "Common Call Ancestors" means that the union of reverse call graphs is taken, rather than their intersection.
        Parameters:
        entryMethods -
        methods1 -
        methods2 -
        events -
        Returns:

                                                                        com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q methods2,
                                                                        com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q events)
        Constructs the Inter-procedural CFG using CFGs of two given sets of methods M1, M2, and the methods containing the following events: Callsites to methods in the union of the reverse call graphs of (m1, m2) for each m1 and m2 in M1 and M2 respectively The computation is restricted to the forward call graph from entryMethods. "Interactions" as opposed to "Common Call Ancestors" means that the union of reverse call graphs is taken, rather than their intersection.
        Parameters:
        entryMethods -
        methods1 -
        methods2 -
        events -
        Returns:
